captions.text:
Miss Scout, you think you could
tell us what happened ?

All of a sudden
somebody grabbed me,

knocked me down
on the ground.

Then Mr. Ewell, l reckon,
grabbed him again, and Jem hollered.

Then somebody grabbed me.
Mr. Ewell, l guess.

and then l heard someone
pantin' and coughin'.

Then l saw someone
carrying Jem.
Why, there he is, Mr. Tate.
He can tell you his name.

[ Atticus ] Miss Jean Louise,
Mr. Arthur Radley.
l believe he already knows you.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird (10/10) Movie CLIP - Scout Meets Boo Radley (1962) HD

comments.text:
Perhaps one of the most perfect scenes ever filmed. In the pantheon of this 
fim's superb performances (James Anderson as the thoroughly hateful Bob 
Ewell a splendid job) this one highlights Robert Duvall's ability to 
express fear, kindness and love without uttering a word. I plan to watch 
this film with my children in hopes they will come to treasure it as I do.﻿

This scene always leaves me a blubbering mess, so I have to say something

comments.author: AmIEasyToFind

comments.text:
If there's one book that I could read over and over again without putting 
it down, then it would have to be Harper Lee's "To Kill A Mocking Bird" and 
the same applies to this movie. It is a shame that such classics are being 
removed from English Literature in England. I remember studying this for my 
Literature exam and the good thing was that I understood it and passed. Its 
a classic and well worth reading and watching.﻿
comments.author: pforpappu

comments.text:
I'm in 9th grade and we are almost done the To Kill a Mockingbird Unit. I 
loved this book. I'm so happy that Harper Lee is making a new book that is 
coming out this year. This next book will be a classic like To Kill A 
Mockingbird. Out of the 3 books that I had to read this year. TKM is tied 
with Night by Elie Weisel. The absolute worse book that I had to read was 
the House on Mango Street because the author is very sexist to males 
throughout the story in addition to living in a poor environment and acting 
like a spoiled brat for it. TKM is to teach you that not only all sexes can 
do exist with another but all races can too.
